link.synopsis: Throughout the course of his travels, a recently arrived Mexican immigrant encounters a multitude of colorful characters, including a nun who uses an orphanage to smuggle drugs, underhanded lawyers, disguised angels and even the devil himself. Full of interesting twists, turns and supernatural mystery, this off-the-wall comedy follows the innocent immigrant's amazing adventures through the United States.
link.title: synopsis
How the Garcia Girls Spent Their Summer

link.synopsis: In a span of 48 hours, struggling author Alan Rigatelli (David Coburn) undergoes a series of awful events in this comedy about life, love and moving forward. After losing his unpublished manuscript and getting fired, dumped by his girlfriend, robbed and attacked, the hapless Alan is a mess. And things go from bad to worse when his womanizing brother, Andrew (Michael McCafferty), and slacker cousin, Nick (Corey Michael Blake), show up at his door.
link.title: synopsis
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: Struggling to find his identity, Denis Byrd (Keith Gordon) enlists in a course called Star Therapy, led by an eccentric professor named Dr. Tuttle (Kirk Douglas) who encourages his students to videotape their lives and make themselves the stars of their own existence. Directed by Brian De Palma, this oddball comedy is almost prophetic, in light of the boom of reality-based TV shows that are built around the lives of ordinary citizens.
link.title: synopsis
To Be or Not To Be
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

link.synopsis: Celebrated speaker and evangelist Ken Davis manages to broach some of the most difficult questions that face Christians without bogging the discussion down with too much seriousness. How? By infusing it with comedy so potent it can only come from a place of honesty and sincerity. Here, he shares some of his best stories and insights, which not only entertain but motivate viewers to embrace a God-centered life.

link.synopsis: In Moscow on New Year's Eve, four friends celebrate at the local bathhouse. The vodka flows as the men toast Yevgeny's (Andrei Myagkov) engagement. Later, amidst their boozy haze, they put him on a plane to Leningrad. After the plane lands, poor Yevgeny stumbles into what he thinks is his own home -- only to wind up being accused of adultery. Eldar Ryazanov directs and co-writes this classic Russian comedy.

link.synopsis: When strapped-for-cash Johnny (Adam Trese) and his mobbed-up friend Manny (John Costelloe) learn that a cool million dollars in drug money is hidden in a neighborhood deli, they hire three amateur crooks to rob the joint at gunpoint. But on the day of the heist, everything goes wildly awry, and soon both the cops and the mafia are after the hapless criminals. Harry O'Reilly directs this caper comedy; Burt Young, Jim Breuer and Tony Darrow costar.

link.synopsis: Drawn from five decades of television, nightclub and Broadway appearances, this program showcases the unique humor of Victor Borge, whose zany blend of classical piano playing, physical comedy and witty wordplay left audiences in stitches. The vintage routines from the man who earned the affectionate moniker "The Clown Prince of Denmark" include "Phonetic Punctuation," "Inflationary Language," "The Timid Page Turner," "Autumn Leaves" and more.

link.synopsis: After rival drivers Ben (Bud Spencer) and the Kid (Terence Hill) tie for first place in a race, they jointly receive a brand-new dune buggy. But when a group of mob goons wreck their prize, the two team up to seek revenge against the local crime boss (John Sharp) in charge. Full of amusing fights and gags, this action-packed slapstick comedy is sure to entertain audiences, especially Hill and Spencer fans.

link.synopsis: When wealthy Uncle Gabriel passes away, his bickering relatives descend upon his isolated house to hear the reading of his will. As an unknown culprit begins killing the guests, Ernie (Kenneth Connor) and Sid (Sid James) try to figure out who's responsible. A spoof of classic whodunit mysteries, this British comedy is based on &NFi;The Ghoul&NFi_;, a novel by Frank King, and also stars Shirley Eaton, Donald Pleasence and Dennis Price.

link.synopsis: Graham Chapman -- a founding member of the famed Monty Python troupe -- began a second career as a public speaker in the early 1980s, touring hundreds of colleges throughout North America to deliver "comedy lectures." His final tour before his death in 1989 is captured here in this hilarious collection of memorable moments, videotaped under the comic's supervision and culled from his personal archives.

link.synopsis: Psychology professor Peter Boyd (Ronald Reagan) plays dad to a chimp to prove himself to his future father-in-law in this madcap comedy. Peter's in love with the dean's daughter, but her pop refuses to accept Peter because his father was a convict. In order to prove that wrongful actions are learned, not inherited, Peter sets out to teach mischievous Bonzo how to be a gentleman. Diana Lynn, Walter Slezak, Lucille Barkley and Jesse White co-star.
link.title: synopsis
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West

The Wackiest Ship in the Army
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House

link.synopsis: Two rubes (Nikolaj Lie Kaas and Mads Mikkelsen) employed by a porcine, autocratic butcher get fed up with his belittling and establish their own charcuterie in Anders Thomas Jensen's inky, low-key comedy. Their mishap in the freezer room gives rise to a savory culinary concoction. Dubbed "chickie wickies," the recipie makes the duo the toast of the town. But as demand for their new dish rises, the population mysteriously shrinks.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop

link.synopsis: In this Christian comedy special, Pastor Greg (Greg Robbins) knows what it's like to live a fast, worldly life; before he gave himself to God, he was a gambler, a playboy and a drunk. But he's turned his life around and soon finds himself assigned to run a stuffy, small-town church. Now, Pastor Greg must learn to win the hearts of an uptight church staff that initially mistakes him for a needy guy off the street.
link.title: synopsis
People Who Met Jesus: Series I
People Who Met Jesus: Series II
The Work and the Glory III: A House Divided

link.synopsis: These three films from the Christiano Film Group present a mix of comedy and drama and revolve around the topics of deception, atheism and Christianity. In The Pretender, a boy poses as a Christian to get a girl of faith to go out with him. In Crime of the Age, a detective tries to figure out who in a group of six people is not a real Christian. And in The Daylight Zone, an atheist tries to prove that Jesus did not exist.
link.title: synopsis
Pretender 2001 / Pretender: Island of the Haunted
God's Outlaw: The Story of William Tyndale
The Passion: According to St. Luke

title.regular: The Pretender / Crime of the Age / The Daylight Zone

link.synopsis: Forest ranger Jackie Zelinski (Monica Serene Garnich) rushes into marriage with a handsome artist in this quirky romantic comedy. After rescuing Hendrix (Jonathan Aube) following a motorcycle accident, Jackie jumps into a whirlwind romance with the artist, who decides to wait until after they're married to reveal the other "significant others" in his life -- his unstable ex-wife (Jennifer Gareis), his spoiled daughter and his troubled son.
link.title: synopsis
Life as We Know It: The Complete Series
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

link.synopsis: Spinal Tap meets "Sesame Street" in Patrick Michael Denny's parody of low-budget children's TV programs. Reminiscent of Greg the Bunny and satirical mockumentaries such as Best in Show, Tom and Francie was a St. Louis Film Festival Top 5 Pick, won Best Comedy at the Digidance Film Festival and was an Official Selection at the Empire State Film Festival. Annie Golden ("Third Watch" and "Cheers") and Steven Skybell ("Sex in the City") star.
link.title: synopsis
How to Eat Your Watermelon in White Company (And Enjoy It)
Tyler Perry's Laugh to Keep from Crying

Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show

link.synopsis: A gay couple's commitment ceremony turns into a dysfunctional affair in this wry comedy. As Ryan (Matt Fentiman) and Grant (Mark Hildreth) prepare to walk down the aisle in an intimate celebration, their guests begin to fall apart at the seams. Couples fight, an overzealous mother goes bonkers with the decorations, the bartender won't shut his trap, the caterer crashes her van, and a mystery man has his eye on one of the grooms-to-be.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: World-class con artist Howard Booth (Peter Bowles) continues to ruin tea time for his stuffy brother-in-law Trevor (George Cole) in this seven-episode collection from the popular BBC comedy. Booth gets out of jail, moves in with Trevor and fools everyone -- especially the ladies -- with his crafty schemes. Trevor's on to Booth's tricks, but can he put an end to it all before the sweet-talking bounder drives him to the brink of insanity?

link.synopsis: A documentary filmmaker struggles to find love and happiness in the Big Apple in this romantic comedy. With help from his sassy straight roommate and best friend, Gwen (Camryn Manheim), David (Anthony Rapp) searches for the perfect boyfriend. He pours his heart and soul into his work and strives for a more meaningful life, and along the way, the two friends find humor in life's inevitable chaos. Stephen Spinell and David Courier co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Chronicling the wacky exploits of lonesome 10-year-old Timmy Turner (voiced by Tara Strong) -- whose fairy godparents are disguised as goldfish -- Nickelodeon's droll animated comedy series appeals to kids as well as grown-ups. In this special musical installment, rock 'n' roll bedlam breaks loose when Timmy gets dispatched to a summer-school camp. Among the extras are four featurettes and a pair of bonus episodes.

link.synopsis: Gadget geek and former professor Peter Chapman (Nicholas Lyndhurst) braves the dangerous world of espionage in this clever British comedy. Recruited as an intelligence agent, Chapman transforms from high-tech tinkerer to undercover operative. On top of tracking terrorists and dodging the bad guys, Chapman must hide his new profession from his increasingly suspicious wife. Clive Francis and John Ringham co-star. Extras include deleted scenes.

link.synopsis: A small-town gal is pushed to the brink of sanity in this dark comedy set in 1953. Distraught by her family's mistreatment of her shell-shocked brother and his untimely death, Anna (Michelle Williams) marries a gangster (Meat Loaf Aday), which only makes things worse. She decides her only hope for sanity is a transorbital lobotomy. But on the day of her operation, she meets sympathetic Tom (Tim Guinee). Can he stop Anna before it's too late?

Groucho Marx: You Bet Your Life: The Lost Episodes

link.synopsis: Vincent Gale, David Hasselhoff and Kim Hawthorne star in this Wild West comedy about cowboy Clint Northern and his rival Dan John Fighting Bear. When the two men are wrongly accused of stealing a casino's bingo payout, they're forced to team up to prove their innocence. Tracked by a ruthless cop and an overzealous security guard, Clint and Dan John encounter one hilarious situation after another as they try to catch the real thieves.

The Lonesome Trail / The Silver Star
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: After receiving an F on his latest assignment, hapless film student Craig needs some solid inspiration. Enter Craig's girlfriend, Simone, who works at the county hospital. Simone insists that the hospital's quack doctors, sexpot nurses and nutty patients would be perfect source material for the budding director. What ensues is one of the wackiest forays into filmmaking in this outrageous inner-city comedy from director Sphear Collins.

link.synopsis: Reverend Dexter (Gerald Orange) of Brooklyn's New Canaan Church tries to honor the last wishes of a deceased nun in this thoughtful comedy. On her deathbed, Sister Glen Moore requests a few minor things for her funeral: a eulogy by Jesse Jackson, a spiritual sung by opera star Benita Cross (Lorene Spain) and an appearance by her estranged mother (Linette Hardie). With a little faith and a lot of patience, Dexter tries his best to make it happen.

link.synopsis: With his flawless timing, comedic brilliance and compelling stage presence, bombastic funnyman Pat Cooper always leaves his sold-out crowds in stitches -- be it in small comedy clubs or in major theaters. His vociferous signature style is clearly in evidence on this riotous video as he delivers diatribes about a potpourri of topics. Bonus material includes Cooper's hysterical take on food, "Mangia, Mangia."

link.synopsis: Matool has survived a zombie holocaust by inventively using his ever-present hammer and nails. When he meets fellow survivors Dexy and Nathan, he's drawn into their world of bizarre sexual experimentation. As their little group slowly begins to grow, Matool finds himself trying to balance wholesale zombie hacking and free-rein sex … a potent combination in this offbeat flick that combines black comedy and sexploitation.

link.synopsis: A starstruck girl's dream comes true when her idol winds up living in her house in this romantic teen comedy. Boy-band singer Chris Trousale of Dream Street plays himself in this tale in which the singing heartthrob is forced to hide out in the home of his most adoring fan (Kaila Amariah). Dream Street performs, and the soundtrack features Ruby Blue and Play. Cindy Williams, Richard Moll, Pat Morita and Morgan Brittany co-star.

link.synopsis: Known by her faithful fans as the "wildest pastor's wife in captivity," Anita Renfroe is a shot of espresso in a decaffeinated world, sharing Christian insights in her trademark zany style. In this showcase of her stand-up comedy, Renfroe's shtick is refreshingly candid, targeting the best -- and worst -- of popular culture, from Martha Stewart to turning the big 4-0. She also pokes fun at pretension with parodies of hit songs.

link.synopsis: Laugh out loud and be inspired by motivational speaker Ken Davis in a comedy concert for the whole family. The best-selling author and radio and television personality entertains with friends McNair Wilson (Earl the Usher), Mike Williams, Joyce Sankey, Bob Stromberg and Taylor Mason and his wisecracking puppets. The group performs hilarious skits and shares heartwarming stories of faith and redemption.

link.synopsis: A terminally ill young man sets out to find his childhood sweetheart and winds up encountering a host of quirky characters in this futuristic comedy. Determined to find his first love, Joyce (Jennifer Morrison), before he checks out, Joe (Mackenzie Astin) packs his painkilling lollipops and hits the road. Along the way, he meets an ex-cult member (John Ales), a roller disco owner (Rachel Wilson) and a shell-shocked ventriloquist (Kyle Gass).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Lea Mentha (Sarah-Jeanne Salvy) is at her wit's end as she must grudgingly face the incontrovertible fact that her boyfriend has skedaddled, her mother's found a new lover, and her sister's too self-obsessed to care about anyone else. So, Lea hires a hypnotist to help her make sense of the bewildering mess. Comedy soon ensues in this quirky and highly original movie set in Montreal. Andre Forcier directs.
link.title: synopsis
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!

link.synopsis: When Norman (Albert Brooks) informs orchestra conductor Claude (Dudley Moore) that his wife, Daniella (Nastassja Kinski), may be having an affair with musician Maxmillian (Armand Assante), Claude slips into a state of insanity and, while conducting the symphony, dreams up an elaborate scheme to murder her. Preston Sturges's 1948 comedy gets a hilarious update from director Howard Zieff; Richard Libertini and Cassie Yates co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Peter Cook & Dudley Moore: The Best of... What's Left of... Not Only... But Also...

link.synopsis: Fed up with her abusive husband, an unstable wife embarks on a murderous scheme in this edgy comedy. Azucena decides to get rid of Felipe to be with Pablo, so she cooks up a plan involving her hypochondriac sister, her mentally challenged employee and her gay cousin. But once she's tasted the sweetness of success, Azucena decides she wants to rub out &NFi;all&NFi_; the annoying people in her life. Neus Asensi, Antonio Resines and Carlos Lozano star.
link.title: synopsis
The Happy Hooker Goes to Washington / The Happy Hooker Goes Hollywood
Turn Left at the End of the World
How to be a Woman and not Die in the Attempt
What Have I Done to Deserve This?

link.synopsis: Director Arnaud Desplechin deftly mixes comedy and tragedy in this tale that traces the intersecting lives of Nora (Emmanuelle Devos), a professionally successful single mom, and her ex-husband, Ismaël (Mathieu Amalric), a neurotic musician who's mistakenly been committed to a mental hospital. Ismaël's comic antics in the asylum are juxtaposed against Nora's anguish upon learning that her father is dying and that her future's uncertain.
link.title: synopsis
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
The Beat That My Heart Skipped

link.synopsis: A man's life changes forever with one selfless act in this romantic comedy. After stopping Louis (Jose Garcia) from committing suicide, well-meaning waiter Antoine (Daniel Auteuil) begins to feel responsible for the depressed man. Continuing to play Good Samaritan, Antoine decides to help Louis win back his ex-girlfriend, Blanche (Sandrine Kiberlain). But the do-gooder doesn't foresee the earth-shattering effect that Blanche will have on him.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Milwaukee's champion ice fisherman, Albert (Troy Garity), isn't sure which way to turn when his controlling mother suddenly dies, leaving her paranoid son to fend for himself. Known for being a little slow, Albert becomes the target of a slew of con artists. Jerry (Randy Quaid) tries to convince Albert that he's his long-lost father, while Tuey (Alison Folland) tries to seduce him. Bruce Dern and Josh Brolin co-star in this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Cave of the Yellow Dog
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: From writer-director Al Attles III comes this down-and-dirty urban comedy that follows the madcap misadventures of two Tidey Whitey Cleaners co-workers trying to latch on to their share of the American Dream. But that's no easy task in the 'hood thanks to breakups, makeups, baby-mama drama, flimflammers, felons and foiled robberies. The cast includes Red Grant, Sadiki Fuller, Nia Willois and Rip the Playa.

link.synopsis: A pair of two-bit crooks on a crime spree steals more than $1 million in cash and bling bling, stashing the booty under an abandoned factory before meeting an untimely demise. The story becomes urban legend till 20 years later, long after a housing project has replaced the plant. When word leaks that an underachieving college student (Andrae Noel) has a clue to the loot's locale, the 'hood goes into a digging frenzy in this genial comedy.

My Big Phat Hip Hop Family

link.synopsis: After being put in charge of one of America's busiest waterways, ham-fisted Ensign Thomas Garland (Robert Morse) finds himself up against three inept jewel thieves who unintentionally dump their booty into the bay. Navigating one mishap after another, Garland takes the wind out of the trio's sails when they hatch a plot to recover their ill-gotten gains. Co-stars Stefanie Powers, Phil Silvers and Wally Cox add to the levity in this Disney comedy.

link.synopsis: Guillermo Francella, Javier Lombardo and Araceli Gonzalez star in this unusual romantic comedy that weighs the importance of truth. Reynaldo (Francella), a photographer, and Tati (Gonzalez), a model, meet at a party and feel a frisson of attraction. But they just can't leave well enough alone. Instead, they both pretend to be someone they're not, and soon, the lies begin to blur into each other, putting their budding relationship in jeopardy.

El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II

link.synopsis: Two ordinary Joes (played by Tommy Davidson and Larry Miller, who also wrote the script) wind up in jail for a crime they didn't commit in this deft comedy. Desperate to escape, they hatch a plan to adopt different identities, but they aren't sure they have the wherewithal to get the job done. The alternative's even worse, however, so they jump into the fray, causing a ruckus in prison in their attempts to finally -- and permanently -- get away.

Kooky Susie gets the job done and then some; when the filing's all finished, the overeager secretary tries to help boss Peter Sands (Don Porter) with his personal problems, much to his dismay. link.synopsis: Beloved comedian Carol Burnett entertained generations of TV viewers with a masterful combo of physical comedy and acting. This biography tells her story, from the broken home life cushioned by a special grandmother to her hilarious appearances on Ed Sullivan's and Jack Paar's shows and her own successful variety show. link.synopsis: Jacques Demy sculpts an entertaining comedy about Marco (Marcello Mastroianni), a man who's improbably pregnant. The driving instructor can't quite believe what's happening to his body and doesn't know how to handle all the changes. His hairdresser wife, Irene (Catherine Deneuve), is at once perplexed, horrified and deeply confused as to how to deal with the situation, especially when the entire world, it seems, shows interest in his condition.

link.synopsis: When auto mechanic Vince Hopgood (Paul Hogan) learns he owes a bundle in back taxes, he turns to pal Ralph Williams (Michael Caton) for help. It seems there's a new law granting retroactive tax breaks to gay couples, so the two pose as beaus to end Vince's money woes. But they may rue their decision when a suspicious auditor (Pete Postlethwaite) arrives to investigate their claim in this quirky comedy.

link.synopsis: Fresh from the stages of Def Comedy Jam, Showtime at the Apollo and BET's Comic View, some of the most hilarious stand-up comedians of all time clean up their acts for this Christian- and family-friendly laugh-fest. Mississippi comedienne Small Frie hosts the extravaganza, which features uproarious "grandma approved" routines by Vince D, Bone, Edwonda White and T.J. McGee. Gather up the entire family for a laughter-filled night of wholesome fun.

link.synopsis: The second season of ABC's comedy series finds uptight cartoonist Henry Rush (Ted Knight) in for a shock: His 42-year-old wife, Muriel (Nancy Dussault), is expecting. But that doesn't stop Henry from fretting over his sexy adult daughters (Deborah Van Valkenburgh and Lydia Cornell), who literally live under his nose in the downstairs apartment. On hand to annoy Henry are clumsy neighbor Monroe (JM J. Bullock) and Muriel's mom (Audrey Meadows).

link.synopsis: In this goofy comedy of errors directed by Alan Spencer, the life of conniving hotel clerk Matthew Welsh (Arye Gross) takes a disturbing turn when internationally famous supermodel Hexina (Claudia Christian) checks in. Through an intricate ploy, Matthew entices the beauty to his digs for a night of unbridled passion. But little does he suspect that Hexina is a paranoid schizophrenic with a deadly past -- who takes Matthew for her extortionist.

link.synopsis: Nadine Hightower (Kim Basinger) and her estranged hubby, Vernon (Jeff Bridges), burglarize a photographer's office to retrieve compromising shots of Nadine. But when the shutterbug ends up dead and the panicked pair grabs the wrong folio, their troubles quickly double. Turns out they've uncovered a conspiracy involving a new Texas highway, and now they must evade not only the cops but also a scheming land baron in this likable caper comedy.

link.synopsis: Home life becomes claustrophobic for dutiful daughter Charlotte (Sylvie Testud) when her widowed mother (Aurore Clement) moves into her tiny apartment in this chaotic comedy. Writer Charlotte finds it impossible to get her work done when mom decides to return to teaching piano. With a steady stream of students invading, there's only one thing to do: sell her home and move to a bigger one. But can she really handle more disorder in her life?

link.synopsis: In a brilliant parody of children's programming, Philadelphia-based comedy troupe Latitude X Multimedia presents a best-of look into the disturbing world of Hellorama. Hosted by half-crazy has-been Jackie Spratlin (Tim Burke), the public access show for kids (and grown-ups) features hilarious sketches such as "Six Flags over Old People," "Fighting Buddha," "The Meanest Man in the World" and the commercial "Sugar Frosted Beef Flakes."

link.synopsis: Director George Zaloom's quirky comedy of manners stars Stanley Tucci as Giovanni Bazinni, a bumbling Italian who journeys to America to help his New Jersey cousin Pop (Giancarlo Giannini) save his fireworks company. As Giovanni wrestles with culture shock and learns the fine points of the family business, young widow Val (Bridget Fonda) sparks his romantic passions. The fine supporting cast includes Talia Shire and Anna Maria Alberghetti.

link.synopsis: In this quirky comedy, a high-powered attorney (Tim Matheson) who was a complete dork when he was a teenager bumps into his childhood crush (Annette O'Toole) at the gym and finds she's still just as beautiful as ever. This chance meeting makes him think long and hard about his life and the decisions he's made; one of the things he realizes is that his current girlfriend is nothing compared to the girl voted "best legs" in the 8th grade!

link.synopsis: Husband-and-wife team Stu Erwin and June Collyer star in this classic 1950s family comedy. It's never a dull moment as Stu, June, their daughters Joyce (Ann Todd) and Jackie (Sheila James) and loyal handyman Willie (Willie Best) wind up in all kinds of kooky situations. Featured are some of the show's most classic episodes, including the one in which Stu advises his daughter about kissing on the first date.

link.synopsis: A handsome architect struggles with his sexual orientation in this Indonesian comedy. Sakti lives with his nagging mother and hides his true feelings in the closet, but things change when he meets attractive television producer Nino. Howie's wacky brand of comedy includes a potpourri of bizarre props, outrageous characters and, of course, plenty of zingers. If you're looking for a double dose of levity, get your prescription filled at zany Howie's house of humor.

link.synopsis: Nothing will stop a daring band of teenagers from retrieving a top secret map in this Russian spy comedy. The Elusive Avengers are back in action, and this time the fearsome foursome must distract the enemy in order to sneak into Counterintelligence Headquarters, crack open the chief's safe, steal a classified map and make it out safely before they're discovered. Viktor Kosykh, Mikhail Metelkin, Vasiliy Vasilyev and Valentina Kurdyukova star.

link.synopsis: Adapted from Pavel Blyakhin's novel &NFi;Red Little Devils&NFi_;, this action-packed comedy was a hit in Russia and remains a beloved classic. Set in the 1920s, the story follows four friends -- a student, a Gypsy, an orphan and his sister -- as they set out to avenge the death of the orphan boy's father. The clever friends disguise themselves and sneak into the enemy's camp, but danger lurks around every corner. Vitya Kosykh and Misha Metelkin star.

link.synopsis: A simple country boy experiences life in the big city in this award-winning Russian comedy. Hoping to get his international airline pilot license, Soviet Georgian helicopter pilot Mimino (Vakhtang Kikabidze) leaves his village and heads to Moscow. Once there, he meets Suren (Frunzik Mkrtchyan), an Armenian. Despite the animosity between their countries, Mimino and Suren revel in many adventures and do their best to annoy uptight city folk.

link.synopsis: Childhood pals grow up and fall apart at the seams in this dark comedy set in the Midwest. Ryan (Connor Ratliff) and Todd have been friends forever, but adulthood proves unfulfilling. Ryan's marriage to Amy (Christina Johnson) is in jeopardy, while Todd lives with his parents and envies Ryan's marriage. When Amy begins confiding in Todd, he's convinced he's having an affair with his best friend's wife, resulting in a series of misunderstandings.

link.synopsis: Unsure what to do next but still partying like there's no tomorrow, 23-year-old Marnie (Kate Dollenmayer) drags herself out of bed for her miserable temp job and can't decide whether she's wasting her time going after best buddy Alex (Christian Rudder), who doesn't seem interested. Director Andrew Bujalksi co-stars as Mitchell, Marnie's stammering co-worker, as Marnie tries her best to navigate life after college in this romantic comedy.

link.synopsis: Traffic school turns into a prison sentence in this comedy from Neal Israel, the director of Police Academy. Deputy Halik (James Keach) runs his driving school for delinquents with an iron fist, but things turn chaotic when he pushes student Dana (John Murray) too far. His car impounded and license revoked, Dana rallies the other misfit students, and the unruly class sets out to get revenge on their crooked instructor. Jennifer Tilly co-stars.

link.synopsis: Two brainless friends get on the wrong side of the meanest mobster Korea's ever seen in this action-packed comedy. Ki-tae (Jang Hyuk) and Chul-soo (Lee Bum-soo) spend their days stealing cars until they get the chance to score big bucks helping the local mob in a drug deal, but they bungle the job. Before they know it, the boys, along with their prostitute friend Meg, are in a wild race to make money before a ruthless thug catches up to them.

link.synopsis: Two prisoners escape from jail unaware that they're about to be released in this Korean comedy. Convict Mu-suk (Cha Seung-Won) secretly digs an escape route, and cellmate Jae Pil (Sul Kyung Ku) is also itching to get out to stop the girl he loves from getting married. Mayhem ensues when the pair escape, but they get the shock of their lives when they find their names on an amnesty list. Can they convince authorities to let them remain free?

link.synopsis: This smart comedy stars Joe Pantoliano as Elliot, a self-professed loser driven back to his hometown by failed dreams of becoming a published author. Perversely content with his low standing in life and unrealized ambition, Elliot's forced to examine his lack of accomplishment when an old friend, a successful film producer, comes to visit. Acceptance of disappointment gives way to jealousy in this midlife musing from writer-director Eric Weber.

link.synopsis: When it first aired in 1967, "At Last the 1948 Show" introduced audiences to a new crop of comedians -- including John Cleese, Graham Chapman and Marty Feldman -- as well as a new brand of humor that would change the face of TV comedy forever. The short-lived series led to the development of the cultish "Monty Python's Flying Circus," which took the troupe's outrageous antics even further.

Featuring work by Terry Jones, Michael Palin, Eric Idle, Terry Gilliam and Bonzo Dog Doo Dah Band leader Neil Innes (whom Gilliam referred to as "the seventh Python"), this collection is a must-see for British comedy fans.

link.synopsis: Monty Python's Eric Idle muses over the funniest moments of the hilarious British ensemble sketch comedy show "Flying Circus" in this entertaining retrospective that pairs the comedian's reflections with clips he's selected as his personal favorites.. The 1970s series showcased the outrageous talents of Idle, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Terry Gilliam, Graham Chapman and Terry Jone, and this program features some never-before-seen footage.

link.synopsis: A curse from the past threatens to destroy a budding romance in this lighthearted comedy. Suffering from a bad-luck spell placed on her family generations ago, Yip (Miriam Yeung) is on the verge of losing her job. She seeks help from dashing feng shui expert Lai (Tony Leung Chiu-Wai), and the two hit it off. But it seems that even the harmonic principles of feng shui can't save the romance when Lai learns of Yip's ancestral curse.

link.synopsis: Facing a grim fiscal future, a struggling summer camp hires hotshot water-ski instructor Ricky Wade (Corey Feldman) to boost attendance and drive up revenue. But the camp's chances of survival take a dive when a rival camp owner (Sarah Douglas) threatens to buy out her competitor. With everything on the line in the lake's annual ski meet, can Ricky find a way to save the camp? Jack Nance also stars in this wacky comedy.

Crevenna helms this charming romantic comedy about a pair of skirt-chasers wooing the two lovely daughters of a land baron -- who rebuffs the young swains to protect his girls. But everything changes when one of the suitors hits the lottery and finds himself torn: Should he tell his chum, or keep all the winnings for himself? The cast includes Júlio Aldama, Irma Dorantes, Manuel López Ochoa and Lucha Villa.
